solution_line_template: First find how many packs Amanda would have to buy on Amazon: {total_lighters_needed} lighters / {lighters_per_pack} lighters/pack = <<{total_lighters_needed}/{lighters_per_pack}={num_packs}>>{num_packs} packs

Then multiply that number by the cost per pack to find the total cost from Amazon: {num_packs} packs * ${cost_per_pack_amazon}/pack = $<<{num_packs}*{cost_per_pack_amazon}={total_cost_amazon}>>{total_cost_amazon}

Then multiply the total number of lighters Amanda buys by the cost per lighter at the gas station: {total_lighters_needed} lighters * ${cost_per_lighter_gas_station}/lighter = $<<{total_lighters_needed}*{cost_per_lighter_gas_station}={total_cost_gas_station}>>{total_cost_gas_station}

Then subtract the total Amazon cost from the total gas station cost to find the savings: ${total_cost_gas_station} - ${total_cost_amazon} = $<<{total_cost_gas_station}-{total_cost_amazon}={savings}>>{savings}
